title: Product of Sines
text: To evaluate the product, rewrite the product of sines as a sum or difference using the following formula: sin(a)sin(b)=1/2[cos(a-b)-cos(a+b)].

title: Identifying Unknown Angles
text: From the formula, what is the value of the unknown angle a?

title: Identifying Unknown Angles
text: From the formula, what is the value of the unknown angle $$b$$?

title: Evaluating the Product
text: To make it easier to evaluate the product, plug in the identified values of a and $$b$$ into the product-to-sum formula.

title: Special Angle Values
text: To evaluate the numeric value, use the known values that $$cos(30)=\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}$$ and $$cos(60)=\frac{1}{2}$$.
